intro: Sloanea fernando-costae, commonly known as the Fernando-Costa sloanea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, specifically Ecuador and Peru. The plant is a shrub or small tree, characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
